citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
Two additional rabbits were identified with hairloss issues during this inspection. Rabbit #836 has one area of hairloss
about 1inx1/2 in in size on the bridge of its nose with the skin appearing reddened. Rabbit #832 has two irregularly
shaped areas of hairloss on the lower bridge of the nose and over the left nares with hair thinning between the left eye
and nares. The skin appears reddened. These two rabbits have not been evaluated by a veterinarian. A review of the
attending veterinarian’s written medical plan dated July, 28 2023 for rabbit #733, which was identified with hairloss during
the last inspection, shows that the attending veterinarian recommended that all rabbits be given Revolution monthly. A
conversation with animal care staff determined that Revolution has not been administered monthly as they did not have
any Revolution available to apply. Medical records reviewed for the rabbits with hairloss did not note any application of
Revolution. Adequate veterinary care including the use of appropriate methods to diagnose and treat diseases and
injuries including following the treatment plan of the veterinarian is necessary to ensure the health and well-being of the
animals.
Rabbits #832 and836 need to be evaluated by a veterinarian and all veterinary treatment plans must be followed. The
facility shall ensure the availability of adequate veterinary care to include the use of appropriate methods to prevent,
control, diagnose and treat diseases and injuries.

Repairs continue to need to be made in the lower pastures’ shelter structures. The damaged and loose insulation boards
were removed from ceiling/top portion of the enclosure housing the goats but remain in the enclosure housing three
sheep. Multiple insulation boards are damaged, and a few are loose to the point of hanging downward from the ceiling. If
they were to fall they may spook the sheep and can be a hazard if ingested by the sheep.
Outdoor housing facilities shall be structurally sound and shall be maintained in good repair to protect the animals from
injury.
This inspection was conducted with the Director of Operations and animal care staff. The exit interview was conducted
with the Director of Operations.
